post.body: G'night! Hope you get your plane.
Congrats on your 400th review. That's quite something.
Doubt it - it's been out of print for ages now. (Still) stupidly delighted anyway! Shall look for the Meyer tomorrow.
I'd have voted for the Meyer - sorry I missed this - been watching the TV.
This must be very hard! Easy to say sit back and enjoy...harder, much harder to accomplish when a doer, I think!
Thank you Alex! Next time the book is hoping for a speaking part.
Can't get over the fact that I was replying to your tweet about missing the prog when a friend txtd to tell me about it.
Heh heh. I shall hold you to that.
Yes, I keep thinking that - and normally do watch it- in fact was just tweeting about missing the programme when a text came in
Jack Dee has now commented on my blog!
one since he's heard it's good...
in the mid of night but she catches him so he says he can't sleep and thought he'd read a book - shows mine - and wd try this
He hears that his wife (an agent) has someone lined up for a part he wants, so tries to sneak into her office in the basement
If you look on the Wikipedia link for Lead Balloon on my blog u will see that the Jack Dee character is a failed comic.
Thanks very much! (Still excited!)
Yes, there is a video http://tinyurl.com/5x6ldz but Susan says it's UK only!
How are things with you at the moment? Are those ulcers any better?
I just want to tell the world - and thru my blog I can:-) Well...the couple of people who happen to read it!
It was 98 Reasons For Being. I know it was just a prop but I don't care. I am delighted.
I've copied the still here: http://tinyurl.com/52yb93
Yes! (re goals). Do more: exercise, reading, writing, learning and do less: eating, and generally wasting time. How 'bout U?
Thank you! It's going to be a better one for you, Susan, I'm sure it is!
Very suitable!
I like planning for a new year...
in support of Simon Singh: http://tinyurl.com/9k4tw2
Just trying to remember how I came across Dr Aust recently - then remembered...
okay - was just thinking about that when I got up this morn for some reason...apart from my usual morning urghgh...
trees - but dancing naked sounds just as good to me - as long as you use woad (or Faberge 'Cornflower')...hope Mel's stitches
Happy Saturnalia! Altho' that was actually a few days ago according to some Roman soldiers I know. I think you have to hug
Finished reading first novel of 2009.
I, Duddy, solemnly swear I am going to do more exercise, reading and writing in 2009 and less eating, drinking and generally faffing around.
Right, 2009 here I come...
Happy New Year! One hour old already!
Set up a new blog for 2009 and going to access it from my ipod. I want to post something the first minute of 2009.
one shot of cointreau and one glass of champagne and I'm trying to focus on my book
Reading THE RINGS OF SATURN by W.G. Sebald. A mixture of Douwe Driaasma and Nicholas Crane. Travel-writing +meditation = something blissful
Christmas dinner again, again...but better because the potatoes are cooked in turkey fat.
Seven bracing miles to get a wall-planner and a diary.
Going for a long walk soon, I hope. Feeling sluggish.
Reading The Rings of Saturn by W. G. Sebald.
